categories.title: Without Shipping
categories.description: Includes visa, housing deposit, first month's rent, and setup costs

categories.title: With Shipping
categories.description: Includes all costs plus shipping a small container of belongings

tips.title: Buy Furniture Locally
tips.description: Turkish furniture is affordable and readily available. Consider only shipping essentials.

tips.title: Choose Your Location Wisely
tips.description: Areas outside major cities like Istanbul can be 30-50% cheaper for housing.

tips.title: Travel Light
tips.description: Each extra suitcase can cost $50-100 on flights. Bring only what you need.

tips.title: Consider Seasonal Timing
tips.description: Winter months often have cheaper apartments and fewer tourists.

turkeyMovingCostsGuide.conclusion: The cost of moving to Turkey is relatively affordable compared to relocating to other European or North American destinations. With proper planning and budgeting, you can make your move to Turkey both smooth and economical.

header.title: Moving to Turkey from the US
header.subtitle: Everything You Need to Know
header.description: Dreaming of a life abroad with rich culture, scenic coastlines, and a lower cost of living? Turkey is increasingly becoming a top destination for Americans seeking a new lifestyle, whether for retirement, remote work, or adventure.
header.subDescription: Here's a complete guide for US citizens planning to move to Turkey, covering everything from visa options to cultural tips.

sections.title: Why Move to Turkey?
sections.content:
Americans are drawn to Turkey for many reasons:

  • โขAffordable cost of living
  • โขMediterranean lifestyle and mild climate
  • โขRich history and world-famous cuisine
  • โขWelcoming local culture
  • โขStrategic location between Europe and Asia

Whether you're moving for work, study, retirement, or simply to enjoy a slower pace of life, Turkey offers diverse options for expats.

sections.title: Visa Options for US Citizens
sections.content:
As a US citizen, you can enter Turkey with a 90-day tourist visa, but for long-term living, you'll need one of the following:

1. Short-Term Residence Permit

  • โข Ideal for digital nomads, remote workers, and first-time expats
  • โข Valid for up to 1 year, renewable
  • โข Requires proof of accommodation, financial means, and valid health insurance

2. Student Visa & Residence Permit

  • โข For those attending university or language courses
  • โข Requires proof of enrollment and financial support

3. Work Visa

  • โข You must secure a job offer from a Turkish employer
  • โข The employer will sponsor your work permit
  • โข After approval, you can apply for a work visa at the Turkish consulate in the US

4. Family Residence Permit

  • โข For spouses or children of Turkish citizens or foreign residents
  • โข Valid up to 2 years

5. Retirement or Property-Based Stay

Buying property in Turkey (no minimum value for residence) makes you eligible for a short-term residence permit

sections.title: Required Documents for Relocation
sections.content:
You'll typically need the following to apply for a residence permit:

  • โขValid US passport (with at least 6 months validity)
  • โขTurkish tax ID number
  • โขProof of accommodation (rental contract or deed)
  • โขHealth insurance (local or private)
  • โขPassport photos (biometric)
  • โขBank statements showing sufficient funds
  • โขCompleted residence permit application form
